meanings.definition: A group of phospholipids found in egg yolks and soybeans.
meanings.sent1: Lecithins are important components of egg yolks.
meanings.sent2: The lecithins in soybeans play a crucial role in various processes.
meanings.sent3: When the chef accidentally spilled lecithins into the batter, the pancakes turned out extra fluffy!
meanings.sent4: The lecithins in egg yolks act like tiny helpers, ensuring everything mixes smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Imagine lecithins as tiny building blocks that hold together the structure of egg yolks.

meanings.definition: Substances that help to emulsify fats in the body.
meanings.sent1: Our bodies rely on lecithins to break down fats effectively.
meanings.sent2: Including lecithins in your diet can support the digestion of fats.
meanings.sent3: The lecithins in our bodies are like little cleaners, making sure fats don't stick where they shouldn't.
meanings.sent4: Lecithins act as friendly mediators, ensuring fats and water get along well.
meanings.sent5: Think of lecithins as peacekeepers between fats and liquids in your body.
